Now all this you can see here was the backstage of the building
They couldn't organize anything without having a backstage. It
was all covered by wooden floor. On top of the wooden floor
they had 9 cm of white sand from the Sahara. Why that kind of
sand? Because that was the best absorbent for the blood. They
were actually refreshing the sand a few times a day, because
of how many fights they had during the day. The main element
was the surprise. Imagine this was the floor of the arena, they
had about 50 trap doors, they could pop up any animals or
gladiators any time from different corners of the place. Then
they were the main events, the gladiator fights. Who were these
guys? They were either prisoners of war, slaves or volunteers -
free man. For the first two catagories, for the prisoners and
slaves they had a special prize; after 7 years of contract was
freedom. For the volunteers, special prize was the fame, the
money and the women. Because the women used to go crazy
for these guys. They were the superstars at that time.
